abstract: A Boolean value that determines whether the system executes the print formatter’s rendering operations on the main thread.
overview:
## Discussion

The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], which requires the printing system to execute rendering operations, like drawing and page-count calculation, on the main thread. Override this property to return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if you want the system to execute operations like [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintFormatter/draw(in:forPageAt:)] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintFormatter/pageCount] on a background thread.

# requiresMainThread

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that determines whether the system executes the print formatter’s rendering operations on the main thread.

## Declaration

```swift
var requiresMainThread: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The default value is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true], which requires the printing system to execute rendering operations, like drawing and page-count calculation, on the main thread. Override this property to return [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] if you want the system to execute operations like [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintFormatter/draw(in:forPageAt:)] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIPrintFormatter/pageCount] on a background thread.
title: requiresMainThread
